summary: This document is a partial transcript from a July 29, 2021, video teleconference (VTC) deposition of an FBI Operational Support Technician. The technician discusses evidence handling procedures related to the Palm Beach Police Department's 2006 search warrant execution on Jeffrey Epstein's property, the creation and review of FBI interview reports (302s), and states the investigation was focused on Epstein and three assistants, not Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'JE'. The document states the FBI investigation was focused on him and three assistants.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as 'GM'. The FBI technician states she was not aware of anything exculpatory regarding Maxwell and that the investigation was not focused on her.

events.title: PBPD Search Warrant Execution & Evidence Transfer
events.description: The Palm Beach Police Department (PBPD) executed a search warrant. FBI agents, including the deponent, subsequently went to PBPD and obtained all their evidence, possibly via grand jury subpoena. The evidence included items seized during the search and interviews of girls.

events.title: FBI Interview of Witness
events.description: FBI agents conducted an interview of a witness (name redacted). The agents flew to the location, conducted a 2-hour interview at the witness's house, and flew out the next day. The process of creating and reviewing the FBI Form 302 (interview report) is described.

events.title: VTC Deposition of FBI Technician
events.description: A video teleconference deposition is conducted with an FBI Operational Support Technician regarding evidence handling and procedures in the Epstein case.

keyFacts: The Palm Beach Police Department executed a search warrant on Jeffrey Epstein's property on August 28, 2006, and the FBI later obtained all evidence from that search.
The FBI technician's investigation was focused on Jeffrey Epstein and three assistants, and she stated she was not aware of anything exculpatory regarding Ghislaine Maxwell.
The document details strict FBI procedures for creating and certifying interview reports (302s), requiring both present agents to review and sign off on the report's accuracy.
The FBI was transitioning from the ACS record system to the Sentinel system around the time of the 2006 investigation, which may explain document format issues.
